data.name: Lanturn

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may change Lanturn's type to Water until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Lanturn is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed. If Lanturn becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed after you have used this power, its type changes back to Lightning.

attacks.name: Blinding Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light, then swallows the immobilized prey in a single gulp.

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.

data.name: Corsola

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: They prefer unpolluted southern seas. Their coral branches lose their color and deteriorate in dirty water.

data.name: Croconaw

attacks.name: Sweep Away
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards from your deck.

data.flavorText: It opens its huge jaws wide when attacking. If it loses any fangs while biting, they grow back in.

data.name: Dragonite-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Dragonporter-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 Dragon Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Leaf Slice
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Vaporeon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Vaporeon but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

data.flavorText: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin that is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

data.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

data.name: Diglett
data.flavorText: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.

data.name: Axew

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Ditto.

data.name: Flaaffy

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

data.name: Plusle

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Plusle does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.

abilities.name: Synergy Effect
abilities.text: If Glacia's Stadium is in play, any damage done to Glalie by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Glalie does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

data.flavorText: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Tapu Bulu

attacks.name: Heavy Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: The guardian deity of Ula'ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.

data.name: Jirachi

attacks.name: One Desire
attacks.text: Search your deck for any 1 card. Shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Doom Desire
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to Jirachi. The Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out at the end of your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.

data.name: Rayquaza

attacks.name: Jaw Lock
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It flies in the ozone layer, way up high in the sky. Until recently, no one had ever seen it.

data.name: Palpitoad

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

data.flavorText: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to capture prey.

data.name: Basculin

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they'll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.

data.name: Machoke

attacks.name: Knuckle Down
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It always goes at its full power, but this very tough and durable Pokémon never gets tired.

data.name: Wooper

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When the temperature cools in the evening, they emerge from water to seek food along the shore.

attacks.name: Double Damage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Horn Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Dark Omanyte

attacks.name: Water Cannon
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage for each Water Energy card attached to Dark Omanyte. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance. You can't do more than 30 damage in this way.

data.flavorText: This ancient Pokémon possessed 10 tentacles, which it used to swim through the ocean.

abilities.name: Pure Body
abilities.text: To attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to Entei, you must discard an Energy card attached to Entei. (Attach the Fire Energy, and then discard an Energy from Entei.)

attacks.name: Burning Fang
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Entei and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Cryogonal

attacks.name: Ice Chain
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Frost Vanish
attacks.text: You may return this Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

data.flavorText: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.

data.name: Araquanid

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Bubble Trap
attacks.text: If 1 of your Pokémon used Bubble during your last turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.

data.name: Wormadam Sandy Cloak

abilities.name: Sandy Cloak
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, excluding damage, done to Wormadam Sandy Cloak.

attacks.name: Push Over
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 damage for each Fighting Energy attached to Wormadam Sandy Cloak.

data.flavorText: When BURMY evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

abilities.name: Energy Recharge
abilities.text: When you play Arcanine from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may flip 3 coins. For each heads, choose a basic Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to Arcanine.

attacks.name: Shake
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: White Flames
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Arcanine.

data.name: Lanturn

attacks.name: Special Tackle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Extreme Current
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Lanturn's light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed "The Deep-Sea Star."

data.name: Corsola

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Pursued by Mareanie for the branches on its head, this Pokémon will sometimes snap its own branches off as a diversion while it escapes.

data.name: Toxicroak

attacks.name: Paralyze Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The toxin made in its poison sacs is pumped to the knuckle claws through tubes down its arms.

data.name: Entei

abilities.name: Bolt
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Entei, unless that attack Knocks Out Entei, flip a coin. If heads, shuffle Entei and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power can't be used if Entei is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when it is damaged.

attacks.name: Protective Flame
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Volcanoes erupt when it barks. Unable to restrain its extreme power, it races headlong around the land.

attacks.name: Lunar Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Benched Pokémon and put that card on that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Fletchinder

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It scatters embers in the tall grass. Then bug Pokémon, frightened by the flames, come flying out, and Fletchinder gobbles them up.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Marill from your hand onto Azurill (this counts as evolving Azurill), and remove all damage counters from Azurill.

attacks.name: Jump Catch
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Scary Face
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: The skin on most of its body is moist. However, the skin on its belly spiral feels smooth.

abilities.name: Undevelop
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may devolve Vaporeon and put Vaporeon into your hand. This power can't be used if Vaporeon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Evolving Aqua
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If Vaporeon evolved from Eevee during this turn, this attack does 60 damage instead.

data.name: Pachirisu

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Electric Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

abilities.name: Head Trip
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Haunter is on your Bench, you may use this power. One of your Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Copperajah V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Adamantine Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Venomoth

abilities.name: Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may change the type of Venomoth to the type of any other Pokémon in play other than Colorless. This power can't be used if Venomoth is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Venom Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

data.name: Solosis

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter how severe.

data.name: Suicune

abilities.name: Wind Charm
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to each of your Pokémon. (Existing effects are not removed.)

data.flavorText: Said to be the embodiment of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.

data.name: Tapu Koko

attacks.name: Flying Flip
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.

abilities.name: Harvest Bounty
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you attach an Energy card to your Active Pokémon as part of your turn, you may attach an additional Energy card to that Pokémon at the same time. This power can't be used if Venusaur is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Energy Return
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), choose an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and return it to your hand. This power can't be used if Espeon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Damage Blast
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Centiskorch VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Centiferno
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you did any damage with this attack, you may attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Dark Gyarados
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

abilities.name: Dark Scale
abilities.text: If Dark Gyarados is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by an opponent's attack, put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Streak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Dialga LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Dialga. Dialga LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Time Skip
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your turn ends. If both of them are tails, after your opponent draws a card at the beginning of his or her next turn, his or her turn ends. This power can't be used if Dialga is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Metal Flash
attacks.text: During your next turn, Dialga can't use Metal Flash.

data.name: Starmie

abilities.name: Space Beacon
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a card from your hand. If you do, put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't choose a card you discarded with the effect of this Ability.)

attacks.name: Star Freeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon has a geometric body. Because of its body, the locals suspect that it is an alien creature.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Gulpin

attacks.name: Endure
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, if Gulpin would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, Gulpin is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

data.flavorText: Almost all of its body is its stomach. Its harsh digestive juices quickly dissolve anything it swallows.

data.name: Vespiquen

attacks.name: Leaf Honey
attacks.text: Discard a Grass Energy attached to Vespiquen and remove all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Grass Pokémon.

attacks.name: Attack Order
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Grass Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's).

data.flavorText: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by COMBEE.

data.name: Golduck

attacks.name: Energy Loop
attacks.text: Put an Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.flavorText: Even fast-swimming fish Pokémon can be disabled by Golduck. It brings them to a standstill and seizes them.

abilities.name: Delta Support
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have a Supporter card with Holon in its name in play, you may search your discard pile for a basic Energy card or a δ Rainbow Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. This power can't be used if Chimecho is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Seismitoad

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

data.flavorText: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.

data.name: Marowak

abilities.name: Bodyguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks done to you or your hand by your opponent's Pokémon. Remove any existing effects.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.

data.name: Scyther

attacks.name: Afterimage Strike
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Scyther would be damaged by an attack, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that attack's damage done to Scyther.

data.flavorText: When it moves, it leaves only a blur. If it hides in grass, its protective colors make it invisible.

data.name: Pichu
rules: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Let's Play!
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Baby Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

data.flavorText: It is not yet skilled at storing electricity. It may send out a jolt if amused or startled.

data.name: Metang

attacks.name: Core Beam
attacks.text: Discard a Metal Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When two Beldum link together, their psychic power is doubled. Their intelligence, however, remains unchanged.

data.name: Lombre

abilities.name: Aqua Lift
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

data.name: Barboach
data.flavorText: Its whiskers make a superb radar. They are used to locate prey, even in the murkiest of water.

data.name: Porygon

attacks.name: Conversion 1
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has a Weakness, you may change it to a type of your choice other than Colorless.

attacks.name: Conversion 2
attacks.text: Change Porygon's Resistance to a type of your choice other than Colorless.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

data.name: Liepard

abilities.name: Limber
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't be Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Don't be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.

abilities.name: Darkness Drive
abilities.text: After your opponent's Pokémon uses a Poké-Power, you may search your discard pile for a basic Darkness Energy card and attach it to Tyranitar.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Tyranitar.

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Bulbasaur.

data.name: Magcargo

abilities.name: Magma Pool
abilities.text: If Magcargo is your Active Pokémon and moves to the Bench, remove 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magcargo, if any, and attach it to the new Active Pokémon. (You can't choose an Energy card that you used to pay the Retreat Cost.)

attacks.name: Lava Flow
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Magcargo when you use this attack. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: The shell on its back is just skin that has cooled and hardened. It breaks easily with a slight touch.

data.name: Samurott

abilities.name: Swaddling Leaves
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Aqua Wash
attacks.text: You may put 2 Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

data.flavorText: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

data.name: Kyogre

attacks.name: Drizzle
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 basic Water Energy cards from your hand and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: High Tide
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy attached to Kyogre. This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.

data.name: Kyurem

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Glaciate
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It generates powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

data.name: Shinx

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

attacks.name: Spiral Dive
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

data.name: Ninetales

abilities.name: Color Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Ninetales is the same type as that Pokémon (all if that Pokémon is more than 1 type) until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Ninetales is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Ninetales.

data.flavorText: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.

data.name: Ampharos

abilities.name: Shocking Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Gigavolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.

data.name: Electrike

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sonic Wing
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

data.name: Umbreon

abilities.name: Moonlight Veil
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that evolves from Eevee has no Weakness, and that Pokémon's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: The light of the moon changed Eevee's genetic structure. It lurks in darkness for prey.

abilities.name: Pure Body
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Suicune, discard an Energy card attached to Suicune. (You can't attach a Water Energy card from your hand if Suicune has no Energy cards attached.)

attacks.name: Hypno Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Heracross

attacks.name: Green Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card for each of your Grass Pokémon in play.

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.

data.name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish-blue.

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Circle Circuit
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Pokémon on your Bench.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.

abilities.name: Water Immunity
abilities.text: You can't attach Water Energy cards from your hand to Articuno.

attacks.name: Freeze Solid
attacks.text: If there are any Water Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Articuno.

attacks.name: Ice Cyclone
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Pokémon in play. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Metal Charge
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on Lairon.

data.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Sky Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

data.name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

data.name: Team Magma Admin
rules: Put up to 3 Team Magma Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Smeargle

attacks.name: Sketch
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacked last turn, and Smeargle was in play during that attack, Smeargle copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack.

data.flavorText: A special fluid oozes from the tip of its tail. It paints the fluid everywhere to mark its territory.

data.name: Litwick

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

data.name: Talonflame

attacks.name: Heat Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flare Raid
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its tough wings don't allow fire to pass through them. A long time ago, firefighters' outfits were made from Talonflame wings.

data.name: Magby

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Magby is Asleep, prevents all damage done to Magby by attacks.

attacks.name: Play with Fire
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Magby is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It is found in volcanic craters. Its body temperature is over 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit, so don't underestimate it.

data.name: Shellos

attacks.name: Regeneration
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: For the most part, it makes its home along the seashore. Its color and form differ according to its habitat and the quality of its food.

data.name: Frillish

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.

data.name: Azumarill

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from the attacks of your opponent's Fire or Water Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of living things on riverbeds.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Lampent

abilities.name: Top Entry
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you drew this Pokémon from your deck at the beginning of your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench.

attacks.name: Reignite
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears just before someone passes away, so it's feared as an emissary of death.

data.name: Skrelp

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.

data.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Assisting Heater
attacks.text: You may attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

data.name: Centiskorch

attacks.name: Hundred Foot Flames
attacks.text: For each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

abilities.name: Relaxing Scent
abilities.text: As long as Erika's Ivysaur is your Active Pokémon, whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to any Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack only does half the damage to that Pokémon (rounded up to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Erika's Ivysaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Double Razor Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Charizard-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Wingull

attacks.name: Roost
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon. It can't retreat during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Fishermen keep an eye out for Wingull in the sky, because wherever they're circling, the ocean sure to be is teeming with fish Pokémon.

data.name: Simipour

attacks.name: Recycle
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

data.flavorText: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Swalot.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Unown [P]

abilities.name: PUT
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown P is on your Bench, you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your Pokémon (excluding any Unown).

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Unown discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

data.name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Searching Magnet
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Lightning Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it's eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.

data.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: The fiery surface of its body gives off a wavering, rippling glare that is similar to the sun.

data.name: Jellicent

abilities.name: Spiteful Spirit
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, the Attacking Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Aqua Bullet
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its body is mostly seawater. It's said there's a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.

data.name: Samurott

attacks.name: Destructive Whirlpool
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Pika Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.

data.name: Pupitar

abilities.name: Boost Gas
abilities.text: If Pupitar has any Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost of Pupitar is 0.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Pupitar.

data.flavorText: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.

abilities.name: Royal Gain
abilities.text: When you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Vespiquen E4, remove 1 damage counter from Vespiquen E4.

attacks.name: Leaf Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Grass Energy attached to Vespiquen E4. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water or Fighting Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Attack
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Ludicolo

abilities.name: Swing Dance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Circular Steps
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each other Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's).

data.flavorText: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo's cells, making it more powerful.

data.name: Palpitoad

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to capture prey.

data.name: Snivy

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.

data.name: Tyranitar

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Trample
attacks.text: For each Benched Pokémon in play (yours and your opponent's), flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its body can't be harmed by any sort of attack, so it is very eager to make challenges against enemies.

data.name: Scraggy
data.flavorText: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.

data.name: Clefable
data.flavorText: It can't help but hear a pin drop from over half a mile away, so it lives deep in the mountains where there aren't many people or Pokémon.

data.name: Wishiwashi-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Torrential Vortex
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Surge-GX
attacks.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Super Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Discard any number of Energy cards attached to any of your Pokémon. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards discarded this way. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Called Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to Exeggutor. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Abomasnow

abilities.name: Blessings of the Frost
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypno Hammer
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

data.name: Torterra

attacks.name: Green Blast
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Some Pokémon are born on a TORTERRA's back and spend their entire life there.

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the total amount of Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

data.name: Emolga

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membranes and released while it is gliding.

data.name: Ducklett
data.flavorText: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food—peat moss.

data.name: Igglybuff

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Igglybuff is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Igglybuff by attacks.

attacks.name: Graffiti
attacks.text: Igglybuff is now Asleep. During your opponent's next turn, the attack cost of each of the Defending Pokémon's attacks is Colorless more.

data.flavorText: Its extremely flexible and elastic body makes it bounce continuously—anytime, anywhere.

data.name: Haunter

abilities.name: Hidden Poison
abilities.text: If Haunter is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Haunter is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Tongue Spring
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

data.name: Raticate

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

data.flavorText: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It seems to slow down if they are cut off.

data.name: Geodude

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

attacks.name: Coral Glow
attacks.text: Draw a number of cards up to the number of your opponent's Basic Pokémon in play. (You can't have more than 10 cards in your hand in this way.)

data.name: Igglybuff
rules: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Good Night Song
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Its extremely flexible and elastic body makes it bounce continuously—anytime, anywhere.

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

data.name: Thundurus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Raiden Knuckle
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Team Plasma Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderous Noise
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Risky Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does no damage to the Defending Pokémon and Giovanni's Machoke does 100 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Headlock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

data.name: Octillery

abilities.name: Abyssal Hand
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It traps foes with the suction cups on its tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.

data.name: Galarian Mr. Mime

attacks.name: Reflect
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its talent is tap-dancing. It can also manipulate temperatures to create a floor of ice, which this Pokémon can kick up to use as a barrier.

data.name: Salandit
data.flavorText: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can't evolve.

data.name: Quagsire

attacks.name: Landslide
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: This carefree Pokémon has an easy-going nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.

data.name: Zangoose

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Zangoose's Lost Claw attack's base damage is 80.

attacks.name: Lost Claw
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and put it in the Lost Zone.

data.flavorText: Its fur would all stand on end if it smelled a Seviper nearby. Its sharp claws tear up its foes.

data.name: Moltres ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Synchronized Lift
abilities.text: As long as you have Articuno ex and Zapdos ex in play, the Retreat Cost for Moltres ex is 0.

attacks.name: Flame Gift
attacks.text: You may move a Fire Energy card attached to Moltres ex to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scorching Wing
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to Moltres ex.

data.name: Duosion

attacks.name: Focused Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Shellder

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.

attacks.name: Wide Laser
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Green Dignity
abilities.text: As long as you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, Vespiquen's attacks do 10 more damage for each Grass Pokémon on your Bench to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bee Drain
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from Vespiquen the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bee Powder
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned.

data.name: Flaaffy

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Flaaffy in order to use this attack. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Lightning Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage times then number of heads.

attacks.name: Electric Current
attacks.text: Take 1 Lightning Energy cards attached to Flaaffy and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you have no Benched Pokémon, discard that Energy card.

data.flavorText: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.

data.name: Vibrava

attacks.name: Sonic Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: To help make its wings grow, it dissolves quantities of prey in its digestive juices and guzzles them down every day.

data.name: Dark Gloom

abilities.name: Pollen Stench
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused; if tails, your Active Pokémon is now Confused. This power can't be used if Dark Gloom is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Its pollen has such a strong smell that it even confuses itself at times.

data.name: Blitzle

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

data.name: Galarian Darmanitan V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Freezing Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Frozen Slice
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its body glows a whitish blue.

data.name: Celesteela

attacks.name: Moon Raker
attacks.text: If the total of both players' remaining Prize cards is exactly 6, this attack can be used for Metal.

data.flavorText: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.

abilities.name: Reactive Aroma
abilities.text: As long as Roselia has any React Energy cards attached to it, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) that has any React Energy cards attached to it between turns. You can't use more than 1 Reactive Aroma Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Flick Poison
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Giratina LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Giratina. Giratina LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Invisible Tentacles
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent discards 1 card from his or her hand. (If your opponent can't discard 1 card, your opponent's Pokémon can't attack.) You can't use more than 1 Invisible Tentacles Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Darkness Lost
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If any of your opponent's Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from this attack, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of discarding it.

attacks.name: Bone Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Fletchling

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.

data.name: Dark Pupitar

attacks.name: Rock Tackle
attacks.text: Dark Pupitar does 10 damage to itself. Dark Pupitar can't use this attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Explosive Evolution
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance. Then, search your deck for an Evolution card named Dark Tyranitar and put it on Dark Pupitar. (This counts as evolving Dark Pupitar.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It is encased within a hard shell, yet retains a great deal of mobility—a dangerous combination.

data.name: Morpeko

attacks.name: Famished
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.

data.name: Starmie BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Starmie BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Break Star
attacks.text: This attack does 100 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon BREAK. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Octillery

attacks.name: Constrict
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Octazooka
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, whenever the Defending Pokémon attacks, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing. (Benching or evolving that Pokémon ends this effect.)

data.flavorText: It traps enemies with its suction cupped tentacles then smashes them with its rockhard head.

attacks.name: Energy Cannon
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dark Houndoom
rules: This Pokémon is both Fire Darkness type.

abilities.name: Fire Breath
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dark Houndoom is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon (choose 1 if there are 2) is now Burned. This power can't be used if Dark Houndoom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Fire Payback
attacks.text: If you have less Benched Pokémon than your opponent, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunderous Assault
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 70 more damage. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness.

data.flavorText: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

data.name: Team Magma Grunt
rules: Discard a card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card, you can't play this card.) Draw 3 cards. If you discarded a Team Magma Pokémon, draw 1 more card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Kabuto
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Dome Fossil Kabuto
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was regenerated from the fossil of an ancient creature. It protects itself with a hard shell.

data.name: Palkia-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Turbo
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Water Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Pearl Hurricane
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Seed
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Chandelure

abilities.name: Protective Glow
abilities.text: All of your Pokémon that have Energy attached have no Weakness.

attacks.name: Mirage Flare
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.

data.name: Rampardos

attacks.name: Assurance
attacks.text: As long as the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP is 60 or less, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

attacks.name: Hasty Headbutt
attacks.text: Rampardos does 20 damage to itself. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its powerful head butt has enough power to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.

data.name: Tapu Koko

attacks.name: Flying Flip
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.

data.name: Pidgeotto

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territory, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

data.name: Sandslash

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

data.name: Victreebel

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

data.name: Cacturne

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Needle Arm
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day's desert heat.

data.name: Skuntank

attacks.name: Stun Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It attacks by spraying a repugnant fluid from its tail, but the stench dulls after a few squirts.

data.name: Lopunny

abilities.name: Healing Tail
abilities.text: As long as Lopunny is your Active Pokémon, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Benched Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.

attacks.name: Rock Toss
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Venom Spray
abilities.text: When you play Beedrill from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Needle Rush
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. If you get 1 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If you get 2 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If you get 3 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 50 more damage. If you get 4 heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 90 more damage.

data.name: Slowbro

attacks.name: Full-Belly Refresh
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 3 damage counters from Slowbro.

attacks.name: Startling Trip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, Slowbro is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Naturally dull to begin with, it lost its ability to feel pain due to Shellder's seeping poison.

attacks.name: Granite Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Lairon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Vanillite

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The temperature of their breath is -58° F. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas surrounding them.

data.name: Furret

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pokémon to enter.

abilities.name: Poison Payback
abilities.text: If Kakuna is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Kakuna is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Swanna

attacks.name: Feather Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of this Pokémon's attacks does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

data.name: Seel
data.flavorText: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. This horn is used for bashing through thick ice.

data.name: Slaking

abilities.name: Energetic Impulse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Slaking is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, Slaking's Lazy Blow attack's base damage is 130 during this turn. If tails, Slaking can't attack or retreat during this turn. (If Slaking is no longer your Active Pokémon, this effect ends.)

data.flavorText: The world's laziest Pokémon. When it is lounging, it is actually saving energy for striking back.

data.name: Parasect

abilities.name: Allergic Pollen
abilities.text: As long as Parasect is in play, cards in any player's discard piles are not affected by attacks or Pokémon Powers. This power stops working if Parasect becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sleep Pinchers
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It stays mostly in dark, damp places, the preference not of the bug, but of the big mushrooms on its back.

data.name: Kyurem

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Glaciate
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

data.name: Electrode

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of "The Bomb Ball."

data.name: Jigglypuff
data.flavorText: Recordings of Jigglypuff's strange lullabies can be purchased from department stores. These CDs can be found near the bedding area.

data.name: Kabutops

attacks.name: Cling
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: A slim and fast swimmer. It slices its prey with its sharp sickles and drinks the body fluids.

data.name: Tropical Beach
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may draw cards until he or she has 7 cards in his or her hand. If he or she does, that player's turn ends.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

abilities.name: Unaware
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, excluding damage, done to Bibarel.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Luxio

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Gliscor

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey… Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

data.name: Heatmor

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: There's a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.

abilities.name: Power of Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Electabuzz is an Evolved Pokémon, you may draw a card from the bottom of your deck. This power can't be used if Electabuzz is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Shell Grab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

data.name: Electrike

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.

data.name: Salazzle
data.flavorText: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.

data.name: Team Magma's Great Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Team Magma Pokémon and a basic Fighting Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Graveler

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.

data.name: Zekrom

attacks.name: Mach Claw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Fusion Bolt
attacks.text: If Reshiram is on your Bench, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.

data.name: Shaymin LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Shaymin. Shaymin LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Revenge Seed
abilities.text: If any of your Grass Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, each of Shaymin's attacks does 60 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Energy Flare
attacks.text: You may move any number of Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Pupitar
data.flavorText: Even sealed in its shell, it can move freely. Hard and fast, it has outstanding destructive power.

attacks.name: Energy Call
attacks.text: Attach 1 Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cannonball
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Delcatty but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost.

data.name: Combusken

attacks.name: Bulk Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of Combusken's attacks does 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.

data.name: Kartana

attacks.name: Divine Paper
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.

data.name: Glaceon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Freezing Gaze
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play, in their hand, and in their discard pile have no Abilities, except for Freezing Gaze.

attacks.name: Frost Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Polar Spear-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: False Charity
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at the top card of your opponent's deck. If it's a Trainer card, put it in your opponent's discard pile; otherwise, put it into his or her hand.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch Baltoy with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

data.name: Froakie

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

data.name: M Gengar-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Phantom Gate
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

data.name: Dark Magcargo
rules: This Pokémon is both Fire Darkness type.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each basic Energy card attached to all of your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Cyndaquil

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.flavorText: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

data.name: Vaporeon

abilities.name: Vitality Cheer
abilities.text: Your Pokémon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee get +60 HP. You can't apply more than 1 Vitality Cheer Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Refreshing Rain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When it's about to be attacked by an invading enemy, it dives into the water to hide.

data.name: Galarian Darmanitan VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Whiteout
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Power Circulation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck. If you do, put 1 damage counter on Sealeo. This power can't be used if Sealeo is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Focus Wall
abilities.text: If Mr. Mime would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack that does 70 or more damage (after applying Weakness and Resistance), Mr. Mime is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

attacks.name: Desperate Slap
attacks.text: If Mr. Mime already has 5 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.

data.name: Wailmer

attacks.name: Wave Swallower
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, heal 50 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.

data.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.

data.name: Mesprit

abilities.name: Psychic Bind
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Mesprit from your hand onto your Bench, you may use this power. Your opponent can't use any Poké-Powers on his or her Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Emotion." It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

data.name: Manaphy-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Aqua Tube
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Water Energy attached to it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Mineral Pump
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Mareanie

attacks.name: Bail Out
attacks.text: Put a Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.

data.name: Dark Golduck

attacks.name: Third Eye
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Dark Golduck in order to draw up to 3 cards.

data.flavorText: When Psyducks evolve, their headaches disappear and they find themselves in possession of formidable mental powers.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Copy
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Copy copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Ditto doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Ditto performs that attack.

data.name: Wormadam Trash Cloak

abilities.name: Trash Cloak
abilities.text: If Wormadam Trash Cloak has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, any damage done to Wormadam Trash Cloak by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Iron Tackle
attacks.text: Wormadam Trash Cloak does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: When BURMY evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

data.name: Salazzle

abilities.name: Roast Reveal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

data.flavorText: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.

data.name: Vaporeon

attacks.name: Cleanse Away
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hyper Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has evolved to be suitable for aquatic life. It can invisibly melt away into water.

data.name: Wobbuffet

attacks.name: Countercharge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, move all damage counters from Wobbuffet to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It desperately tries to keep its black tail hidden. It is said to be proof the tail hides a secret.

data.name: Bayleef
data.flavorText: A spicy aroma emanates from around its neck. The aroma acts as a stimulant to restore health.

abilities.name: Anticipation
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, excluding damage, done to Toxicroak G.

attacks.name: Deep Poison
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Zebstrika

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

data.name: Mareep

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.

data.name: Hitmontop

attacks.name: Repeating Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokémon, then, if you have any Benched Pokémon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

abilities.name: Carry Off
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent has any Baby Pokémon, Basic Pokémon, or Evolution cards there, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck. This power can't be used if Crobat is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Double Cross
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. If both of them are tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.name: Alolan Raichu

abilities.name: Surge Surfer
abilities.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It only evolves to this form in the Alola region. According to researchers, its diet is one of the causes of this change.

abilities.name: Intimidating Pattern
abilities.text: As long as Masquerain is your Active Pokémon, any damage done by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't use more than 1 Intimidating Pattern Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
